video_description:
32GB version: http://www.memoryexpress.com/Products/PID-MX32979(ME).aspx
16GB version: http://www.memoryexpress.com/Products/PID-MX32978(ME).aspx
Keyboard/Docking station: http://www.memoryexpress.com/Products/PID-MX32980(ME).aspx
http://www.facebook.com/memoryexpress/
http://www.facebook.com/memoryexpress.meghan/

Meghan from Memory Express reviews ASUS' brand new Eee Transformer tablet-notebook. 

The tablet is available on April 26th 2011 in-store and online!

Don't forget to subscribe! Thanks for watching.
title: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101: Hands-on Review, HD 1080P

comments.text: I have fallen in love with this tablet since I first heard of it, and now that I know the price I love it even more! As a student and a programmer, I can take this to school and not only take notes but remote connect into my computer at home to do my programming while I'm away! Also, the fact that this has TWO sd card slots (micro on the device and full on the kb) means that﻿ storage is not an issue at all.
comments.author: freekyfrogy

comments.text: The two full USB ports will also allow me to use standard USB flash drives to transfer files around, as well as possibly even plug in a USB mouse for when I remote into my PC! Geez, I could just keep ging on and on about how absolutely﻿ perfect this tablet is for me. Thanks you, ASUS, for FINALLY doing it right!
comments.author: freekyfrogy

comments.text: Well then I know exactly the one I'm gonna get for the wifie!!! She'll really﻿ love this thing ...
